keyword.value: Stockholm+50 : a Healthy Planet for the Prosperity of All - our Responsibility, our Opportunity (2022 : Stockholm)
keyword.showAs: Stockholm+50 : a Healthy Planet for the Prosperity of All - our Responsibility, our Opportunity (2022 : Stockholm)

step.by: submitted by the President of the General Assembly

docTitle.span: Participation of non-governmental organizations, civil society organizations, indigenous peoples’ organizations, academic institutions, the scientific community, the private sector and philanthropic organizations in the international meeting entitled “Stockholm+50: a healthy planet for the prosperity of all – our responsibility, our opportunity”

content.p:
At its 60th plenary meeting, on 28 February 2022, the General Assembly, on the proposal of its President,
A/76/L.37. recalling paragraph 24 of its resolution 75/326 of 10 September 2021, as well as paragraph 15 of annex II thereto, decided to approve the participation of relevant non-governmental organizations, civil society organizations, indigenous peoples’ organizations, academic institutions, the scientific community, the private sector and philanthropic organizations, as listed in the annex to the present decision, as observers in the international meeting entitled “Stockholm+50: a healthy planet for the prosperity of all – our responsibility, our opportunity” and its preparatory meeting.
Afeka Tel Aviv Academic College of Engineering
African Youth Initiative on Climate Change – Zimbabwe
Arab Youth Climate Movement Qatar LLC (G)
Asian Peoples Movement on Debt and Development
Association des Volontaires pour l’Environnement Sain
Association for Solidarity through Humanitarian Imperative Action (ASHIA) International
ASSOCIATION INTERNATIONALE VILLES ET PORTS INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATIONS CITIES AND PORTS (AIVP – IACP)
Basic Education and Employable Skill Training Pakistan
Centro Agronómico Tropical de Investigación y Enseñanza (CATIE)
Chalmers University of Technology (Gothenburg Centre for Sustainable Development (GMV))
Círculo Médico de Morón Hurlingham e Ituzaingó
Collectif des Leaders pour le Développement durable de l’Afrique
College of Diplomatic Studies and International Relations
Conseil des Architectes d’Europe (Architects Council of Europe)
Council on Energy, Environment and Water
Disaster Reduction and Environment Protection Forum (DRAEPF)
Engineering Association for Development & Environment – EADE
Environment and Social Development Organization – ESDO
Global Climate and Health Alliance, a project of the Social Good Fund
Global Strategic Institute for Sustainable Development – GSISD
H & M Hennes & Mauritz GBC AB
Heimdall technologies Corp and GBM Project
Human Development and Natural Environment Conservation Centre
Humanitarian Organization for Poverty Eradication (HOPE WORLDWIDE – PAKISTAN)
Institute for Environmental Studies (IVM)/Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
Inter-American Institute on Justice and Sustainability (IIJS, LLC)
International Youth Society Internet of Planet AB (Exponential Roadmap Initiative)
Japan Civil Society Network on SDGs
LEHO – Ladakh Environment And Health Organisation
Mistra Center for Sustainable Markets (Misum) at Stockholm School of Economics
National Religious Partnership for the Environment
Nature Conservation Advocates for Climate Initiative
Open Society European Policy Institute (OSEPI; part of the Open Society Foundations)
Parlement des Jeunes Leaders de la Société Civile Guinéenne
Raoul Wallenberg Institute of Human Rights and Humanitarian Law
Réseau panafricain des jeunes pour la culture de la paix
Stichting World’s Youth for Climate Justice
Student Platform for Engineering Education Development (SPEED)
Sustainable Energy and Enterprise Development for Communities (SEED4Com)
The Beijer Institute at the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences
The Real Group Academy (The Real Group Inspiration AB)
The Swedish Institute of International Affairs
The Swedish Peace and Arbitration Society (Svenska Freds- och Skiljedomsföreningen) – SPAS
The Uganda National Apiculture Development Organisation (TUNADO)
UNITED NATIONS ASSOCIATIONS of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana (APUNA) Andhra Pradesh United Nations association
VIDEA – a BC based International Development Education Association
Women Empowerment Against Poverty of Nepal (WEAPoN)
ZERO – Association for the Sustainability of the Earth System
